thread.title: River Hill, Atholton football battle for playoff lives
thread.title_full: River Hill, Atholton football battle for playoff lives

author: Tim Schwartz
title: River Hill, Atholton football battle for playoff lives
text:
River Hill, Atholton football battle for playoff lives River Hill football Photo courtesy of Israel Carunungan 
The River Hill football team, seen here during its game against Long Reach last week, will face off against Atholton on Oct. 23 with big playoff implications hanging in the balance. 
The River Hill football team, seen here during its game against Long Reach last week, will face off against Atholton on Oct. 23 with big playoff implications hanging in the balance. (Photo courtesy of Israel Carunungan) Tim Schwartz Contact Reporter Rivals River Hill and Atholton square off on Oct. 23 as both teams battle for playoff position 
As the Howard County football season winds down, inching closer to the playoffs, teams' true identities are starting to show. 
For Atholton, which started the season 1-3 after a 34-0 shutout at home versus Wilde Lake, that sentiment is holding true, as the Raiders have won three straight games to improve to 4-3 to jump into playoff contention. 
River Hill, meanwhile, is still looking to find its groove as it sits at 3-4 on the season, but the Hawks’ schedule is favorable the rest of the way. 
When the two squads face off on Oct. 23 at River Hill, it could in all likelihood make or break each team’s season. 
“It’s a huge game. This is the biggest game within the last three or four years for the program, not only because we’re above .500 and we have a chance to go to the playoffs, but the extra incentive is we play River Hill, our rivals,” said Atholton coach Bruce Cummings. “So we have a chance to not only get in the playoffs by beating them, but crushing our rivals' dreams of getting in the playoffs as well. That adds a little more fire to the game, and makes it really important to everybody on the team and coaching staff.”
